qas.question: In what country was the trading base for the Dutch?
Where did the British initially establish a trading base?
What was the third European country to establish trading with India?
What actions by the Indian kingdoms gave the European traders the opportunity to acquire lands and influence?
To whom did the foreigners lose most of their acquired lands?

context: The next to arrive were the Dutch, with their main base in <a0_0>Ceylon<a0_0/>. The British—who set up a trading post in the west coast <a1_0>port of Surat<a1_0/> in 1619—and the <a2_0>French<a2_0/>. The <a3_0>internal conflicts<a3_0/> among Indian kingdoms gave opportunities to the European traders to gradually establish political influence and appropriate lands. Although these continental European powers controlled various coastal regions of southern and eastern India during the ensuing century, they eventually lost all their territories in India to the <a4_0>British<a4_0/> islanders, with the exception of the French outposts of Pondichéry and Chandernagore, the Dutch port of Travancore, and the Portuguese colonies of Goa, Daman and Diu.[citation needed]
